Setting LDAP Configuration Options

To perform this procedure, you must first select the project database or project you want to configure. The project database or project must also be associated with a configuration file.

The LDAP authentication options let you configure Version Manager for use with a Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) authentication server. To make use of this feature, you must:

  • Have a functional LDAP server.
  • Select LDAP ID as one of your login sources.
To set LDAP Authentication options:
  1. Select Admin | Configure Project. The Configure Project dialog box appears.

  2. If not already selected, select the Show Advanced Options check box.

  3. Select LDAP Configuration beneath Security. The LDAP Configuration pane appears on the right. The fields display the current settings as defined in the configuration file associated with the project database or project.

  4. To enable the Secure Socket Layer, select the Use SSL (Secure Socket Layer) checkbox.

  5. To allow Version Manager to follow referrals from one LDAP server to another, select the Follow referrals check box. Use this feature to support properly configured non-redundant distributed servers.

  6. Specify the base user context (distinguished name) in the Base User Context field. This is the base from which to search for users.

  7. Select the user naming attribute in the User Naming Attribute list. This is the attribute in which the LDAP server holds the user ID value.

  8. Select a method of querying the LDAP server to retrieve the list of users:

    • To query anonymously, select the Bind Anonymously check box. This requires that the LDAP server is configured to allow anonymous users to retrieve a list of users and attributes.

      NOTE You cannot bind anonymously to a Microsoft Active Directory Server.

    • To require a user ID and password for queries:

      1. Specify a full user DN in the User DN field.

      2. Specify a user password in the Password field.

  9. Enter a value in the Connection timeout field to set the idle time in seconds before the connection to the LDAP server times out.

  10. Click OK.
